oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Joseph W. Knox to his mother
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Joseph William Knox of Dyer, Tennessee, served in Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt. He arrived in France Sept. 1918 and fought the last week of the Meuse-Argonne offensive. After the war, he remained on guard duty. Suffering from pneumonia, he wrote his mother from a hospital, noting that the American nurse made "everyone in the A.E.F. feel better." Knox hoped to see the sights of Luxembourg and thought combat troops would not leave until Germany signed the peace treaty. [See also GWjack018-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
